marketNews.title: Sri Mulyani Replaced by Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa as Finance Minister
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto today, Monday (8/9), replaced Sri Mulyani from the position of Finance Minister, a post she had held for almost 14 years in the last 20 years. As her replacement, President Prabowo inaugurated Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, who has served since 2020 as Chairman of the Board of Commissioners at the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS). Following this decision, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed down 1.28% to 7,767, and the one-month NDF rupiah rate against the US dollar weakened 1.07% to 16,585 by late afternoon. Prior to today’s reshuffle, Sri Mulyani was often rumored to resign from her post. Rumors of her resignation resurfaced at the end of August 2025 after her house was looted during a large demonstration. State Secretary Prasetyo Hadi, in today’s press conference, only explained that the removal of Sri Mulyani from her position is a presidential prerogative. According to Bloomberg, Sri Mulyani has been a symbol of fiscal credibility for the last three Indonesian presidents and is widely recognized for helping Indonesia secure investment-grade credit ratings. Purbaya previously served in government as Deputy Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment and as a special staff member of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs. Before entering government, Purbaya was a senior economist at Danareksa Research Institute and the chief executive officer of PT Danareksa Sekuritas.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know
marketNews.content:
1. U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that non-farm payrolls (NFP) in August 2025 increased by only 22,000, well below the consensus expectation of 75,000. July 2025 NFP data were revised up from 73,000 to 79,000. June 2025 NFP was revised from an increase of 14,000 to a decrease of 13,000, marking the first decline since December 2020. The unemployment rate rose from 4.2% in July 2025 to 4.3% in August 2025, the highest level since October 2021. In response, the market is currently expecting a Federal Reserve rate cut in September 2025 with a probability of 100%, based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool.
2. The Ministry of Finance and Bank Indonesia said on Monday (8/9) that burden-sharing will be carried out prudently. Under the scheme, Bank Indonesia will pay a higher interest rate on government deposits to help finance housing and cooperative programs launched by President Prabowo’s administration. The ministries did not disclose the interest rate level, the amount to be paid, or the program duration. The measure was taken amid growing concerns about the impact of these programs on the budget.
3. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said that the free trade agreement with the European Union (IEU-CEPA) will be signed on 23 September 2025. Earlier, in June 2025, Airlangga said the agreement would give Indonesia zero tariffs for about 80% of its export products to the EU and remove non-tariff barriers, aiming for greater market access for footwear, garments, palm oil and fishery products. According to several media reports, Indonesian commodities subject to EU tariffs include palm oil derivatives with rates around 5-12.8%, biodiesel (palm-oil based) around 8-18%, textiles around 8-12%, and seafood around 16-20%.
4. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Monday (8/9) that the government targets online shopping festival (Harbolnas) 2025 transaction volume to reach 35 trillion rupiah, a 12.2% year-on-year increase compared with 31.2 trillion rupiah in 2024. Harbolnas 2025 will be held from 10-16 December 2025.
5. Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia’s foreign exchange reserves at the end of August 2025 fell to 150.7 billion US dollars (down from 152 billion in July 2025). The decline was driven by external debt repayments and exchange rate stabilization measures. The reserve level at the end of August 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.3 months of imports or 6.1 months of imports plus external debt payments.

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Gold Resources Announces IPO Plan for EMAS
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Gold Resources, a subsidiary of Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA), plans to conduct an IPO offering up to approximately 1.6 billion (10%) new shares at a price range of 1,800–3,020 rupiah per share. The proceeds, estimated at about 2.9–4.9 trillion rupiah, will be used for: 1) a phased capital contribution of 328.4 billion rupiah to PT Pani Bersama Tambang; 2) a loan of 328.4 billion rupiah to PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera; and 3) the remaining amount to repay MDKA debt early. The offering period is expected to run from 17–19 September 2025, with listing scheduled for 23 September 2025.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific Updates Progress for TPIA
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific announced on Monday (8/9) that the construction progress of its chlor-alkali and ethylene dichloride (CA-EDC) plant has reached 33%. Economically, the project targets ethylene dichloride production for export, potentially generating foreign exchange of up to 5 trillion rupiah per year, while substituting imported caustic soda could save the country up to 4.9 trillion rupiah annually. A feasibility study is underway to assess downstream opportunities that could add greater value, improve efficiency, and strengthen the domestic chemical value chain.

tickerNews.title: Providentia Wealth Management Acquires PACK Shares
tickerNews.content: Providentia Wealth Management Ltd. purchased approximately 230.5 million shares of Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama at an average price of 228 rupiah per share on 4 September 2025. The transaction value totals about 52.5 billion rupiah and is intended for long-term investment. After the transaction, Providentia’s ownership in PACK increased from zero to roughly 14.43%.

tickerNews.title: Adhi Karya Announces LRT Receivable Payment Schedule for ADHI
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya’s President Director, Entus Asnawi, stated that the receivable from the Jabodebek Light Rail Transit (LRT) project, amounting to 2.2 trillion rupiah, will be paid by PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) at the earliest by the end of 2025. Chief Financial Officer Bani Iqbal explained that the repayment process is currently being discussed with the Ministry of Finance, PT KAI, and Danantara.

tickerNews.title: MINE Shares Purchased by Director Arabella Sumendap
tickerNews.content: Sinar Terang Mandiri Director Arabella Sumendap bought approximately 75.6 million shares of MINE at an average price of 467 rupiah per share on 2 September 2025. The transaction value totals 35.3 billion rupiah. After the purchase, Sumendap’s direct ownership in MINE rose from zero to 1.85%.

tickerNews.title: Basis Utama Prima Acquires UANG Shares
tickerNews.content: PT Basis Utama Prima purchased approximately 196.4 million shares of Pakuan at a price of 467 rupiah per share on 3 September 2025. The transaction value is about 91.7 billion rupiah. Following the transaction, Basis Utama Prima’s stake in UANG increased from zero to 16.24%. PT Basis Utama Prima is owned by Happy Hapsoro, who also holds shares in Rukun Raharja (RAJA) and Sanurhasta Mitra (MINA).
